alert.note: Alert for Kent (Michigan) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued April 06 at 10:30AM EDT until further notice by NWS Grand Rapids
info.description: ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Michigan... Grand River near Comstock Park affecting Kent County. .One to two inches of rain has fallen during the past 36 hours and will take a few days to flow from tributaries into the river. Generally dry weather is expected during the next week. ...FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL FURTHER NOTICE... * WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring and major flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Grand River near Comstock Park. * WHEN...Until further notice. * IMPACTS...At 16.0 feet, Major flooding on homes along Abrigador Trail, Willow Drive, Riverbank Street and Konkle Drive. In Comstock Park and Plainfield Township approximately 100 homes affected by flooding. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 7:16 AM EDT Thursday the stage was 13.8 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 7:16 AM EDT Thursday was 13.8 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise to a crest of 16.3 feet early Saturday afternoon. - Flood stage is 12.0 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 16.4 feet on 05/21/2020. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov/grr.
